definition: to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique

sentences.english: The official was dismissed from office because he feathered his own nest with the relief fund for flood.
sentences.chinese: 那位官員被解除職務，因爲他拿水災救濟金營私自肥。

sentences.english: Some tax collectors feather their own nests while they have opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 有些收稅員有機會即營私中飽。

sentences.english: Party B causes great loss to Party A due to its breach of duty and jobbery.
sentences.chinese: 乙方嚴重失職，營私舞弊，給甲方利益造成重大損失。

sentences.english: Government programs lend themselves so easily to waste, fraud and abuse.
sentences.chinese: 政府項目太適合被浪費，營私舞弊與濫用了。

sentences.english: LiBiao resolution with SanYing privately turned to kill leopards ditch LinZhenHai.
sentences.chinese: 李彪決議帶着三營私自轉到豹子溝殺掉林振海。

sentences.english: How to Dissolve Labor Contracts on Grounds of Serious Dereliction of Duty or Practice of Graft?
sentences.chinese: 如何以勞動者嚴重失職或營私舞弊爲由解除勞動合同？

sentences.english: I dare say he jobs in elections.
sentences.chinese: 我敢說他在選舉中肯定營私舞弊。

sentences.english: The factory has not formulated the policy which prohibit form cliques for private gain.
sentences.chinese: 工廠沒有制定書面的禁止結黨營私的政策。

sentences.english: This American company is steeped in fraud up the armpits.
sentences.chinese: 這家美國公司營私舞弊極爲嚴重。
